newsitem.title: CHINA: China lifts margin requirement in rubber contract.
newsitem.headline: China lifts margin requirement in rubber contract.

text.p: The China Commodity Exchange will lift the margin requirement in the key August 1997 rubber contract, the exchange in southern Hainan province said in a statement on Wednesday.
The margin requirement in the contract would be raised to 10 percent from July 30, to 25 percent from August 4, and to 30 percent from August 11 for long positions, the statement said.
The margin requirement was usually 6.5 percent, traders said.

The exchange would also ban investors from building new positions in the contract from Wednesday and said it would force some members to offset their positions according to market movements, the note said.
The August contract has fluctuated in a wide range in recent weeks as the confrontation between long and short positions has grown increasingly fierce.
It ended at 12,670 yuan ($1,528) per tonne on Tuesday, up 400 yuan from Monday's close.
